N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 57-1.2 - Filing of application for approval as a provider

State Regulations
(a) A person or organization seeking approval
as a provider shall submit to the commissioner, an application on forms
prescribed by the commissioner, with a fee of $300. (b) To be approved, each applicant shall
submit evidence acceptable to the department that the applicant: (1)
has and will maintain adequate resources
to offer the coursework or training; (2)
has and will ensure that faculty and
educational specialists who will offer the coursework or training shall have
demonstrated by training, earned degrees or experience, their competence to
offer the coursework or training; (3)
affirms in writing that the training will
be conducted through use of a curriculum which, at a minimum, includes the
syllabus prepared by the department; and
(4)
affirms in writing that Certification of

Completion forms obtained from the department will be issued to students upon
completion of the coursework or training for their use in documenting
satisfaction of the requirement of coursework or training in the identification
and reporting of child abuse and maltreatment. Notes
